study_plan_entry.title: HydroPower and Dams: Benefits and Concerns

free_text.Learning outcomes: [li] Knowing the benefits and concern s of large hydraulic  schemes and infrastructures for use of water resources  with focus on hydropower plants and dams[br/][li] Analyzing the challenges of designers  and  owners of such large hydraulic schemes in view of environmental, social and economical impact[br/][li] Discussion of mitigation measures and project development strategies[br/][li] Comparison of view of project promotors and NGO's[br/][li] Analysis of critical issues as people displacement, GHG emissions from reservoirs, hydropeaking and residual flow.[br/]
free_text.Content: Main benefits of hydraulic schemes and dams as power production (electricity) and grid management , flood protection, irrigation, drinking water supply, navigation, leisure activities, fish production  and creation of new biotopes[br/]Importance of renewable  and green energy, gain factors of different production types and sustainable development,  previsions of energy  consummation, politics and need of water, chances and dangers of liberalization of power markets[br/]Concerns about environmental, social and economical impacts and its consideration in the early phases of the project definition[br/]Evaluation and decision procedures in order to optimize the positive effects and to minimize the negative effects of projects[br/]Methods and strategies for negotiation with parties concerned by the projects and NGO's; establishment of partnership between all actors of a project; public awareness and information strategies[br/]Alternatives for large hydropower schemes (small and mini hydro, alternatives energies, a.s.o.) [br/]
free_text.Keywords: Hydropower, dams, environmental and social impacts, renouvable energy, benefits and concerns
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Bases in hydraulics and hydraulic schemes
